inference:
The perimeter of one of the four congruent rectangles is $2(y-x)+2x=2y-2x+2x = 2y$

**Final Answer: \boxed{$2y$} **I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth: Let $l$ represent the longer side of the rectangle, which makes the shorter side of the rectangle $y-l$ (since one long side and one short side make up $y$). Then the perimeter of one of the rectangles is $2l+2(y-l)=2l+2y-2l=\boxed{2y}$.
